abstract: Rick Wagoner said G.M. is not ready to concede its No. 1 position, but offered scant evidence that it could fend off a challenge from Toyota.
snippet: Rick Wagoner said G.M. is not ready to concede its No. 1 position, but offered scant evidence that it could fend off a challenge from Toyota.
lead_paragraph: DETROIT, Jan. 4 — General Motors is not ready to concede its position as the world’s largest automaker, the chief executive, Rick Wagoner, said Thursday, but he offered scant evidence that the company could fend off a challenge from Toyota, its Japanese rival.

headline.main: Saying the No. 1 Ranking Is Worth Keeping, G.M.’s Chief Vows to Fight Toyota
headline.print_headline: Saying the No. 1 Ranking Is Worth Keeping, G.M.’s Chief Vows to Fight Toyota

abstract: The chief executive of Ford Motor, Alan Mulally, has said he traveled to Japan last month to meet with Toyota Motor executives just to show his respect for what they had accomplished, not in an effort to bring the companies any closer. Reports that the chairman of Toyota, Fujio Cho, had met in Tokyo with Mr. Mulally at Mr. Mullaly’s request had sparked talk of a potential alliance. Mr. Mulally squelched that speculation again Wednesday, saying that manufacturing methods – along with safety engineering, fuel economy and environmental issues – were topics that all automakers discussed with one another.
lead_paragraph: The chief executive of Ford Motor, Alan Mulally, has said he traveled to Japan last month to meet with Toyota Motor executives just to show his respect for what they had accomplished, not in an effort to bring the companies any closer. Reports that the chairman of Toyota, Fujio Cho, had met in Tokyo with Mr. Mulally at Mr. Mullaly’s request had sparked talk of a potential alliance. Mr. Mulally squelched that speculation again Wednesday, saying that manufacturing methods – along with safety engineering, fuel economy and environmental issues – were topics that all automakers discussed with one another.

headline.main: Ford Chief Squashes Talks of a Toyota Alliance
